poem:
"Upon Reading the Morning News"

In quiet morning stir,  
the tale of a novelist unfolds,  
chaotic in print yet ripe  
with the taste of adventures.  
Discarded lives between book bindings,  
amid the scent of stale coffee and newsprint.  
Bitter and sweet, all at once,  
a testament to existence:  
Better Broken Than New.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Better Broken Than New by Lisa St Aubin de Terán review – from bank robber’s bride to best young novelist With notable, largely historical exceptions, literary lives can be disappointingly dull to read about. Not so Lisa St Aubin de Terán’s. Better Broken Than New is the novelist and memoirist’s first book since 2007 and its vivid, sometimes chaotic narrative details – adventures and misadventures enough for multiple lifetimes – leave the reader wondering not". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
